Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
Inventory.java This class represents an inventory of devices.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Class
    Description

    Inventory.Category
    Enumeration of device categories.

  • Constructor Details

    • Inventory

      public Inventory()
      Constructs a new Inventory object.

  • Method Details

    • addDevice

      public void addDevice(Scanner scanner)
      Adds a device to the inventory using the user input.
      Parameters:
      scanner - the scanner to get input

    • removeDevice

      public void removeDevice(Scanner scanner)
      Removes a device from the inventory using the user input.
      Parameters:
      scanner - the scanner to get input

    • updateDevice

      public void updateDevice(Scanner scanner)
      Updates a device in the inventory using the user input. The user can update the price and quantity of the device.
      Parameters:
      scanner - the scanner to get input

    • listDevices

      public void listDevices()
      Lists all devices in the inventory. The devices are listed by category. The user can see the category, name, price, and quantity of each device. If there are no devices in the inventory, an error message is displayed.

    • findCheapestDevice

      public void findCheapestDevice()
      Finds the cheapest device in the inventory. The user can see the category, name, price, and quantity of the cheapest device. If there are no devices in the inventory, an error message is displayed.

    • sortByPrice

      public void sortByPrice()
      Sorts all devices in the inventory by price. The devices are sorted in ascending order by price. The user can see the category, name, price, and quantity of each device.

    • calculateTotalValue

      public double calculateTotalValue()
      Calculates the total value of all devices in the inventory. The user can see the total value of all devices in the inventory.
      Returns:
      the total value of all devices in the inventory

    • restockDevice

      public void restockDevice(Scanner scanner)
      Restocks a device in the inventory using the user input. The user can add or remove stock from the device. The user can see the new quantity of the device. If the device is not found, an error message is displayed.
      Parameters:
      scanner - the scanner to get input

    • exportInventory

      public void exportInventory() throws Exception
      Exports the inventory to a file. The user can see the category, name, price, and quantity of each device. The user can also see the total number of devices and the total value of the inventory.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs
